caption:
This photograph depicts a person engaged in clam digging at the waterside. The individual appears focused on their task, using a clam digging tool to excavate the sandy shore. They are dressed appropriately for the activity, wearing dark waterproof boots, green waterproof overalls, and a white t-shirt. The setup includes them carrying a net attached to their back, possibly to hold the clams they collect.

The scene is set against the backdrop of a beach, with waves gently breaking in the distance and a tranquil, clouded sky. There is a sense of peaceful industry in the scene, capturing both the calm of the shore and the labor involved in clamming. The color palette is naturalistic, dominated by blues, greens, and earth tones, highlighting the coastal environment. The focus and composition of the photo convey a moment of everyday work within a natural setting, emphasizing the connection between the individual and their environment.
title: Resident of the Quinault Indian Reservation digs for razor clams on Quinault Beach. The clams are sold commercially by the Indian community.
